Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body and a raised circular base, flat below. The filling-hole is surrounded by a wide inward-sloping rim with a raised edge, defined by a groove. The long nozzle has a splayed end and rounded tip, and is divided from the body by a transverse relief band on top. There is a long solid lug on the left side, decorated with three short parallel grooves.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q562)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs W N Weech
